channel.title: Ok > doors
channel.description:
ok in lumbridge castle downstairs after opning the main door (thats easy) on the left theres door
1536
and right theres door 1536
so when i put case 1536 thats the door
i put
case 1536:
ReplaceObject(3215, 3211, 1536, -2); break;
what would i do for the other door ??
because the id is the same >?< i don't understand

item.title: Ok > doors
item.dc:creator: @billynom8s billynom8s
item.description:
@billynom8s wrote:

sorry i didnt respond … thankyou all for your imput i do not wish to delet the object just to make it change places =-0 its done now and thankyou

also i open 1 now and… both open i got this

		case 1536:
			if (absX == 3215 || absX == 3211) {
			ReplaceObject(3215, 3211, 1536, -2);
			}
			if (absX == 3215 || absX == 3225) {						
			ReplaceObject(3215, 3225, 1536, -2);						
			}
			break;

and it worked ? but as i said both open ((at the same time))

Read full topic

item.title: Ok > doors
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Orphaned case means you’ve used that case number twice in a switch statement. You have to use one or the other, not both.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok > doors
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Please also keep in the back of your head that he has not responded yet, which means that he has not tried your method yet. I am just supplying another method in case yours does not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok > doors
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Are you trying to delete the door, then spawn another object there? If so, just use your deleteObjects() method, then spawn another object with your makeGlobalObject() method.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok > doors
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

add a } on the end of the code above the orphaned case and it should fix that.

also, you could just delete your doors with deletethatwall method.

im not sure if it would work with that but you could try deletethatobject method also if it doesnt work.
